features: DURABLE FRYING PAN WITH EVEN HEAT DISTRIBUTION: Frying pan features durable hard-anodized aluminum construction that heats quickly and evenly
DISHWASHER SAFE NONSTICK: Fry pan is dishwasher safe for easy cleaning and has long-lasting nonstick interior for effortless food release and cleanup
DUAL-RIVETED, GRIPPY HANDLES: The frying pan's comfortable grippy handles are double-riveted for extra strength
OVEN SAFE: Oven safe to 350°F, this nonstick frying pan is a great complement to many other items in the Rachael Ray collections
BUILT FOR CONVENIENCE: Large frying pan has a convenient helper handle for moving big portions from stove to oven to table
body.description: Crafted from hard-anodized aluminum, this handsome Rachael Ray Cucina Hard-Anodized Nonstick 14-Inch Skillet with Helper Handle provides fast, even heating, helping to reduce hot spots that can burn foods. It’s the ideal pan for preparing sunny-side-up eggs for family breakfast in the morning and pan-searing marinated pork chops for an evening meal with friends. The appealing espresso-colored nonstick is long-lasting to provide easy food release and cleanup. Offering a comfortable grasp, the skillet’s rustically-styled silicone-over-stainless-steel handles are dual riveted for added strength and boast an earthy, modern hue for a dash of color - the helper handle aids in moving the pan between kitchen stations. Oven safe to 400 degrees F, the durable pan is suitable for all stovetops, except induction. Dishwasher safe for convenience, this inviting skillet makes an attractive addition to serveware, dinnerware and other cookware pieces in the beautiful Rachael Ray Cucina collection. Day and night, enjoy the rustic, modern style of the professionally crafted Rachael Ray Cucina Hard-Anodized Nonstick 14-Inch Skillet with Helper Handle.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Rachael Ray Cucina Hard-Anodized Cookware Even the simplest recipes get star treatment with Rachael's stylish, colorful nonstick pots and pans in the Cucina collection. From cookware, bakeware and dinnerware, to easy-to-use cutlery, kitchen tools and teakettles, Rachael Ray's kitchenware collections feature solution-driven products that help prepare meals from start to finish - all in colorful style. In your kitchen and on your table, add beautiful hues and rich flavor to every dish with Rachael's products.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty, sturdy, reasonably priced: easily replaces the expensive Anolon that peeled!
reviews.reviewText: First let me say that this skillet is big! And I’m happy about that. I needed something larger, but with low sides, as this one has.The blue is pretty—it’s blue only on the handles—and is a sort of blue-green.The bottom came with a scratch—I can barely see it but it’s there and I don’t know if that’s a manufacturer mark, shipping, or what, but otherwise it is perfect. I almost took off a star for that but I’m so pleased with the skillet and the price I bought it for, I left my stars at 5.No sticking so far. I washed mine by hand and though on the bottom is indicates it is dishwasher safe, I’m likely to hand wash it most of the time—due partly to the size of it; however, it does fit fine in the dishwasher.There are two sturdy handles: both handles are stainless but with the colored covering that feels like rubber—cool touch covering. There is the long handle side, firmly attached and sturdy; there is the shorter handle on the other side that is also attached firmly and sturdily—the shorter side helps if you have to pick up the skillet with something heavier in it since it is a large skillet so you aren’t trying to hold it with one hand.The skillet sat evenly on my stovetop without any rocking or movement at all.The price is very reasonable. I had a anodized nonstick skillet from Anolon that cost over $60 and it began peeling very badly after about a year or less; this Rachael Ray is half the cost of that—time will tell how long it will last but at least the price is more reasonable and it’s a bigger and nicer looking skillet than the Anolon.The only other items I have from Rachael Ray’s kitchen collection is a set of blue bowls and I’ve really loved those bowls! They’re quality, they look good on my countertop, and they’re made very well; the price was reasonable on those as well. So I’m likely to take a look at some of her other kitchen items.I’m happy with my purchase and hoping there’s no peeling. It does come with care instructions and I read those to make sure I do everything to care for the skillet properly—it comes with a lifetime warranty as long as you care for it properly!This fits exactly what I needed and I’m so glad I bought it!I hope my review helped you today.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Skillet I've Ever Owned!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this skillet in the 14" size to replace a 10 year old skillet I had that wasn't nonstick anymore. This one retails for about $100 and I got it on Amazon for about $39, so I was thrilled with the deal and was amazed at the size of it when it arrived. It is a little bigger than the biggest burner on my stovetop, but it still cooks evenly. I've used it almost daily for the last 2 months and I've made a variety of things in it: stir fry, beef stroganoff, scrambled eggs, sautéed meats, grilled cheese, and French toast to name a few. Because it's so large, I can make 3 grilled cheese sandwiches at once and 4 pieces of French toast at once, so it cuts down on cook time for some of the things I make.The pan is excellent quality and the nonstick aspect works wonderfully even without using olive oil or butter. I don't use metal cooking utensils with this, so I've had no issues with nonstick coating coming off as others have mentioned. I also wouldn't store it underneath other pans, which may have contributed to other reviewers having the coating come off. The rubberized handle is easy to grip and I love the bonus handle on the opposite side, which makes it really easy to pour food out of the skillet. Cleaning it is very easy using a non-scratch sponge. I love this skillet and I highly recommend it for all your cooking needs - wish I would've bought it sooner!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Large, good quality skillet, just no lid
reviews.reviewText: Bought this in 2018 for the wife. She wanted a large skillet for some recipes and the current set based skillets just were not large enough.This thing is huge in comparison. Perfect for her pastas and just about anything else we throw at it.There is no lid with this, or at least not when I bought it. So if you need to steam something you have to get creative like a cookie sheet, sadly. It also doesn’t fit in the dishwasher well. Would probably look for a mode with a lid next time I am in the market. But if one doesn’t exist, I will come back to this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2017
reviews.reviewText: This skillet is LARGE but easy to handle. It is shallow so perfect for bacon and eggs, browning meat, hasbrowns, etc but not so good for sauces, as the non stick coating works very well.... food slides right out without issue and the low sides would make it challenging to stir without making a mess. As far as even heating, I have a gas range that has a power burner (flame is larger than the rest) and it heats the entire skillet, so for me, it cooks evenly. ... Not sure how it would do on elecric burners. The coating has not scratched using silicone utensils. I hand wash it after it cools completely, which is how non stick surface pans should be washed, no matter what brand. Nylon utensils WILL scratch non stick pans due to the firm edges... use silicone and your skillets will last longer. Is it perfect? No. ... but overall, I really like this skillet and recommend it for anyone needing a large skillet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great skillet, nice size and clean up is effortless.
reviews.reviewText: We were in the need for a new skillet and this is the one we landed on. The non stick coating works great and good doesn’t get stuck. Clean up is also easy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this pan
reviews.reviewText: Bought this as a Christmas gift and have loved it. The large size is very useful and nothing sticks to it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is one of the best frying pans I own.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent for large meals.
reviews.reviewText: Very large pan and well received
Queríamos un sartén grande con Teflon y este está muy bien. Sería excelente si viniera con tapa.
This is my favourite pan. I had a really hard time finding a pan large enough for my largest burner, and this one is perfect. It cooks evenly and is not flimsy.

Larger pan allows for easier cooking of pancakes and bacon. Non stick coating works beautifully. Very easy to clean and sits on stove nicely and evenly. Stay cool handles are a great addition! It arrived earlier than expected. Great fry pan!
Bought this for hubby as he wanted a large fry pan for bacon. It’s perfect and he loves it! I make eggs and pancakes on it and it’s superb!
